page.p: This is the dumbest blog template possible written in an archaic xml based framework.
Seriously. W3 last talked about this technology in 2017.

So, this probably is all fine. I mostly don't understand the inner workings because ChatGPT vibed with me for a few days... so I'm logging a bunch to console. Either way, you're welcome, and I'm sorry, for this. vgr

To use this framework for blogging. Record a blog entry in ./content/blog.xml First Post This is a description of the blog post 2024-04-01 VGR These fields are used to populate the blogs header. Make sure the date matches the blog file name and the date in the file. Create a file in ./content/ YYYYMMDD.xml Insert the following code. 2025-07-07

Why am I here

 The date field is used to associate this entry with ./content/blog.xml make sure it matches. You can put any HTML you want into content If you get xml errors wrap the erroring code in CDATA
This framework comes equiped with an "easy" to use theme engine. By default it comes with:

ul.li: You'll find body.dark and other themes waiting. Copy and paste a theme block, give your theme a new body.$name.
Once named and set go to console.log("Theme Script") and add your theme to the array of names.
Finally add the theme button inside <aside class="sidebar"> by copying an existing button and modifying id="btn-$name", background:#, and fill:#.

page.p: Oh also I'm using a licensed font. input mono because frankly its the perfect font and I love it. Its not licensed to you, and probably won't work. So you'll have to rip it out of the CSS...
Check out the premade template to see all of the different html tags in action with the theme. I probably covered everything in a 5 dollar bootstrap theme. Maybe not. who cares.
